bookCover.coverDescription: A well-described explanation of the basic fundamental process of mathematics.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division have application even in the most advanced mathematical theories. Thus, mastering them is one of the keys to progressing in an understanding of math. That is why they are considered as Fundamental process of Mathematics. We will start by understanding addition and so on...

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Addition is bringing two or more numbers (or things) together to make a new total.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio

Try It

Write this down in your copy, with the answer, using numerals and click to see the answer whether you got it right or wrong.

metadata.title: Q1- Which of the following pictures represent 2 + 1 = 3 ?

params.text: Addition of four digit numbers with carry over

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Let's see a example to better understand the above diagram.

• Add the digits in the ones place : 2 + 9 = 11, 11 ones = 1 ten + 1 ones
  • Add the digits in the tens place : 1 + 6 + 6 = 13, 13 tens = 1 hundred + 3 tens
  • Add the digits in the hundreds place : 1 + 8 + 3 = 12, 12 hundreds = 1 thousand + 2 hundreds
  • Add the digits in the thousands place 1 + 5 + 2 = 8

metadata.title: Q2- Add the following numbers and fill in the correct answers.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Subtraction is the process of taking away a number from another. It is a primary arithmetic operation that is denoted by a subtraction symbol (-) and is the method of calculating the difference between two numbers.
Subtraction formula:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
When we subtract two numbers, we use some terms which are used in the subtraction expression:

  • Minuend: The number from which the other number is subtracted. 
  • Subtrahend: The number which is to be subtracted from the minuend.
  • Difference: The final result after subtracting the subtrahend from the minuend.

The subtraction formula is written as: Minuend - Subtrahend = Difference

Let us understand the subtraction formula or the mathematical equation of subtraction with an example.
Here, 9 is the minuend, 7 is the subtrahend, and 2 is the difference.
State True or False:

params.text: Subtraction of five digit numbers
Let's see some examples to better understand the above diagram.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Subtraction without borrowing

• Subtract the digits in the ones place 4 – 1 = 3
  • Subtract the digits in the tens place 9 – 7 = 2
  • Subtract the digits in the hundreds place 5 – 4 = 1
  • Subtract the digits in the thousands place 7 – 4 = 3
  • Result : 3123
Subtraction with borrowing

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• Subtract the ones, where 8 > 6. So, borrow 1 then it will be 16. Now 16 – 8 = 8
  • Subtract the tens, 2 < 7. Borrow 1 from the hundreds, then 12 – 7 = 5
  • Subtract the hundred, 4 < 6. So, borrow 1 from the thousands, then 14 – 6 = 8
  • Now subtract thousands, 7 – 3 = 4
  • Result is 4858
Subtract the numbers and fill in the correct answers.

metadata.title: Q5- Subtract the numbers and fill in the correct answers.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Multiplication is an operation used in math to multiply different types of numbers. The obtained result after multiplication is known as a product. For example, you bought 7 cupcakes for your birthday party and your friends bought 7 cupcakes more. Now to find the total number of cupcakes we will use multiplication here i.e., 2 times 7 is 14. This can be written in a mathematical form of multiplication expression as 2 × 7 = 14. Please note that the same calculation can also be done using addition operation as, 7 + 7 = 14 cupcakes. That is why we say that multiplication is nothing but repeated addition.
Multiplication examples:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Multiplication tables can be extremely helpful in doing basic arithmetic calculations. These work as building blocks for doing higher maths like fractions, exponents, and many more. Multiplication table is provided below to help you learn times tables effortlessly.
Multiplication of two digits by one digit.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• Multiply 6 ones by 3.
  • Then 3 × 6 = 18, write 8 as result and 1 as a carry over.
  • Again multiply 5 tens by 3, i.e. (3 × 5) = 15, write (15 + 1) = 16 as a result.
Multiplication of three digits by one digit.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• Multiply 3 ones by 4. 4 × 3 = 12, write 2 as a result and 1 as a carry over.
  • Multiply 6 tens by 4, (4 × 6) = 24 tens. Add (24 + 1) tens = 25 tens, then 5 as a result and 2 as a carry over.
  • Again, multiply 5 hundreds by 4. 4 × 5 = 20, write 20 + 2 = 22 as a result.
Multiplication of two digit numbers by two digits.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: While multiplying 2 tens, put zero (0) in the ones place of the second line and multiply by 2.
Multiplication of three digit number by two digits.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: While multiplying 4 tens, put zero (0) in the ones place of the second line and multiply by 4.
Multiply the following numbers and fill in the correct answers.

metadata.title: Q6- Multiply the following numbers and fill in the correct answers.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Division is one of the four basic mathematical operations, the other three being addition, subtraction, and multiplication. In simple words, division can be defined as the splitting of a large group into equal smaller groups.

Division can be introduced by considering objects from our daily life like slices of pizza or a bar of chocolate. For example, if we divide a pizza into 4 slices, we do division. Thus, 1 ÷ 4 = 0.25. This means, that each piece of the slice of this pizza is 0.25 times the total pizza. Let's learn this concept in more detail.
Division of two digit numbers by one digit:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• First divide 5 by 4, 1 will be a remainder.
  • Take 8 down. Now it becomes 18.
  • Divide 18 by 4, 2 will be a remainder.
Division of three digit numbers by one digit:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• First divide 5 by 5, there will be no remainder.
  • Take 6 down and divide it by 5, 1 will be a remainder.
  • Take 5 down and it will be 15 including the remainder.
  • Divide 15 by 5; there will be no remainder.

Verification
Dividend = Divisor × Quotient + Remainder
565 = 5 × 113 + 0
565 = 565 + 0
565 = 565 verified.
Division of three digit numbers by two digit numbers:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Verification
Dividend = Divisor × Quotient + Remainder
708 = 14 × 50 + 8
708 = 700 + 8
708 = 708 verified.
Divide the following numbers and fill in the correct answers.

8,983 toys were sold in both the years.
